byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and GARDINER HARRIS
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from Katmandu, and Gardiner Harris from New Delhi. Chris Buckley and Bhadra Sharma contributed reporting from Katmandu.

lead_paragraph: After a cry from within the rubble, a boy was found trapped under a metal shutter. A concrete slab was poised above him — held up by a flattened motorcycle.

headline.print_headline: Survivors Lay Amid Rubble and Bodies
headline.main: Nepal Survivors Lay Amid Rubble and Bodies After Earthquake

snippet: After a cry from within the rubble, a boy was found trapped under a metal shutter. A concrete slab was poised above him — held up by a flattened motorcycle.
abstract: Rescue workers in Nepal free two people from debris five days after earthquake, offering residents some hope; death toll has exceeded 5,800, with many more confirmed deaths expected.
